intro: Collania jamesoniana, commonly known as the Jameson's collania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
